title: Alternative definitions of function values (2)
content: In the following, a second approach is followed to define function values alternately to ~ df-afv . The current definition of the value ` ( F `` A ) ` of a function ` F ` at an argument ` A ` (see ~ df-fv ) assures that this value is always a set, see ~ fex . This is because this definition can be applied to any classes ` F ` and ` A ` , and evaluates to the empty set when it is not meaningful (as shown by ~ ndmfv and ~ fvprc ). "` ( F `` A ) ` is meaningful" means "the class ` F ` regarded as function is defined at the argument ` A `" in this context. This is also expressed by ` F defAt A `, see ~ df-dfat . In the theory of partial functions, it is a common case that ` F ` is not defined at ` A `. Although it is very convenient for many theorems on functions and their proofs, there are some cases in which from ` ( F `` A ) = (/) ` alone it cannot be decided/derived whether ` ( F `` A ) ` is meaningful ( ` F ` is actually a function which is defined for ` A ` and really has the function value ` (/) ` at ` A ` ) or not. Therefore, additional assumptions are required, such as ` (/) e/ ran F ` , ` (/) e. ran F `, ` F defAt A ` or ` Fun F /\ A e. dom F ` (see, for example, ~ ndmfvrcl ). To avoid such an ambiguity, an alternative definition ` ( F '''' A ) ` (see ~ df-afv2 ) would be possible which evaluates to a set not belonging to the range of ` F ` ( ` ( F '''' A ) = ~P U. ran F ` ) if it is not meaningful (see ~ ndfatafv2 ). We say "` ( F '''' A ) ` is not defined (or undefined)" if ` ( F '''' A ) ` is not in the range of ` F ` (` ( F '''' A ) e/ ran F `). Because of ~ afv2ndefb , this is equivalent to ` ( ( F '''' A ) = ` ` ~P U. ran F `. If ` ( F '''' A ) ` is in the range of ` F ` (` ( F '''' A ) e. ran F `), we say that "` ( F '''' A ) ` is defined". If ` ran F ` is a set, we can use the symbol ` Undef ` to express that ` ( F '''' A ) ` is not defined: ` ( F '''' A ) = ( Undef `` ran F ) ` (see ~ ndfatafv2undef ). We could have used this symbol directly to define the alternate value of a function, which would have the advantage that ` ( F '''' A ) ` would always be a set. But first this symbol is defined using the original function value, which would not make it possible to replace the original definition by the alternate definition, and second we would have to assume that ` ran F e. _V ` in most of the theorems. To summarize, that means ` ( F '''' A ) e/ ran F -> ( F `` A ) = (/) ` (see ~ afv2ndeffv0 ), but ` ( F `` A ) = (/) -> ( F '''' A ) e/ ran F ` is not generally valid, see ~ afv2fv0 . The alternate definition, however, corresponds to the current definition (` ( F `` A ) = ( F '''' A ) ` ) if the function ` F ` is defined at ` A ` (see ~ dfatafv2eqfv ). With this definition the following intuitive equivalence holds: ` ( F defAt A <-> ( F '''' A ) e. ran F ) `, see ~ dfatafv2rnb . An interesting question would be if ` ( F `` A ) ` could be replaced by ` ( F ''' A ) ` in most of the theorems based on function values. If we look at the (currently 24) proofs using the definition ~ df-fv of ` ( F `` A ) `, we see that analogues for the following 7 theorems can be proven using the alternative definition: ~ fveq1 -> ~ afv2eq1 , ~ fveq2 -> ~ afv2eq2 , ~ nffv -> ~ nfafv2 , ~ csbfv12 -> csbafv212g , ~ rlimdm -> ~ rlimdmafv2 , ~ tz6.12-1 -> ~ tz6.12-1-afv2 , ~ fveu -> ~ afv2eu . Six theorems proved by directly using ~ df-fv are within a mathbox ( ~ fvsb , ~ uncov ) or not used ( ~ rlimdmafv , ~ avril1 ) or experimental ( ~ dfafv2 , ~ dfafv22 ). However, the remaining 11 theorems proved by directly using ~ df-fv are used more or less often: * ~ fvex : used in about 1600 proofs: Only if the function is defined at the argument, or the range of the function/class is a set, analog theorems can be proven ( ~ dfatafv2ex resp. ~ afv2ex ). All of these 1600 proofs have to be checked if one of these two theorems can be used instead of ~ fvex . * ~ fvres : used in about 400 proofs : Only if the function is defined at the argument, an analog theorem can be proven ( ~ afv2res ). In the undefined case such a theorem cannot exist (without additional assumtions), because the range of ` ( F |`` B ) ` is mostly different from the range of ` F `, and therefore also the "undefined" values are different. All of these 400 proofs have to be checked if ~ afv2res can be used instead of ~ fvres . * ~ tz6.12-2 (-> ~ tz6.12-2-afv2 ): root theorem of many theorems which have not a strict analogue, and which are used many times: ** ~ fvprc (-> ~ afv2prc ), used in 193 proofs, ** ~ tz6.12i (-> ~ tz6.12i-afv2 ), used - indirectly via ~ fvbr0 and ~ fvrn0 - in 19 proofs, and in ~ fvclss used in ~ fvclex used in ~ fvresex (which is not used!) and in ~ dcomex (used in 4 proofs), ** ~ ndmfv (-> ndmafv2nrn ), used in 124 proofs ** ~ nfunsn (-> nfunsnafv2 ), used by ~ fvfundmfvn0 (used in 3 proofs), and ~ dffv2 (not used) ** ~ funpartfv , ~ setrec2lem1 (mathboxes) * ~ fv2 : only used by ~ elfv , which is only used by ~ fv3 , which is not used. * ~ dffv3 (-> dfafv23 ): used by ~ dffv4 (the previous "df-fv"), which now is only used in mathboxes ( ~ csbfv12gALTVD ), by ~ shftval (itself used in 11 proofs), by ~ dffv5 (mathbox) and by ~ fvco2 (-> ~ afv2co2 ). * ~ fvopab5 : used only by ~ ajval (not used) and by ~ adjval , which is used in ~ adjval2 (not used) and in ~ adjbdln (used in 7 proofs). * ~ zsum : used (via ~ isum , ~ sum0 , ~ sumss and ~ fsumsers ) in 76 proofs. * ~ isumshft : used in ~ pserdv2 (used in ~ logtayl , ~ binomcxplemdvsum ) , ~ eftlub (used in 4 proofs), ~ binomcxplemnotnn0 (used in ~ binomcxp only) and ~ logtayl (used in 4 proofs). * ~ ovtpos : used in 16 proofs. * ~ zprod : used in 3 proofs: ~ iprod , ~ zprodn0 and ~ prodss * ~ iprodclim3 : not used! As a result of this analysis we can say that the current definition of a function value is crucial for Metamath and cannot be exchanged easily with an alternative definition. While ~ fv2 , ~ dffv3 , ~ fvopab5 , ~ zsum , ~ isumshft , ~ ovtpos and ~ zprod are not critical or are, hopefully, also valid for the alternative definition, ~ fvex , ~ fvres and ~ tz6.12-2 (and the theorems based on them) are essential for the current definition of function values.

blocks.name: cafv2
blocks.content: Extend the definition of a class to include the alternate function value. Read: "the value of ` F ` at ` A ` " or " ` F ` of ` A ` ". For using several apostrophes as a symbol see comment for ~ cafv .
blocks.origin: prop class cafv2(class c0, class c1) { (c0 '''' c1) }

blocks.name: diff.cafv2.s
diff.cafv2.c
diff.cafv2.w
df-afv2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the value of a function, ` ( F '''' A ) ` , also known as function application (and called "alternate function value" in the following). In contrast to ` ( F `` A ) = (/) ` (see comment of ~ df-fv , and especially ~ ndmfv ), ` ( F '''' A ) ` is guaranteed not to be in the range of ` F ` if ` F ` is not defined at ` A ` (whereas ` (/) ` can be a member of ` ran F ` ). (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: dfatafv2iota
blocks.content: If a function is defined at a class ` A ` the alternate function value at ` A ` is the unique value assigned to ` A ` by the function (analogously to ` ( F `` A ) ` ). (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ndfatafv2
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` if the function is not defined at this set ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ndfatafv2undef
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` is undefined if the function, whose range is a set, is not defined at ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: dfatafv2ex
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` is always a set if the function/class ` F ` is defined at ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 6-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2ex
blocks.content: The alternate function value is always a set if the range of the function is a set. (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2eq12d
blocks.content: Equality deduction for function value, analogous to ~ fveq12d . (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm afv2eq12d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cafv2(c0, c1), cafv2(c2, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c1, c3))
} = {
  3eqtr4g(cafv2(c0, c1), cafv2(c2, c3), cif(cio(hs0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c0))), wdfat(c0, c1)), cif(cio(hs0, wbr(c3, c2, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c2))), wdfat(c2, c3)), w0)
  ifbieq12d(cio(hs0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c0))), cio(hs0, wbr(c3, c2, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c2))), w0, wdfat(c0, c1), wdfat(c2, c3))
  dfateq12d(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  iotabidv(hs0, w0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0)), wbr(c3, c2, cv(hs0)))
  breq123d(c1, c0, cv(hs0), c3, c2, cv(hs0), w0)
  eqidd(cv(hs0), w0)
  pweqd(cuni(crn(c0)), cuni(crn(c2)), w0)
  unieqd(crn(c0), crn(c2), w0)
  rneqd(c0, c2, w0)
  df-afv2(hs0, c0, c1)
  df-afv2(hs0, c2, c3)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm afv2eq12d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(c0 '''' c1)=(c2 '''' c3))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 = c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 = c3)
} = {
  3eqtr4g((c0 '''' c1), (c2 '''' c3), if(c0[defAt]c1, iota(hs0, c1[c0]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c0))), if(c2[defAt]c3, iota(hs0, c3[c2]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c2))), w0)
  ifbieq12d(iota(hs0, c1[c0]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c0)), iota(hs0, c3[c2]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c2)), w0, c0[defAt]c1, c2[defAt]c3)
  dfateq12d(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  iotabidv(hs0, w0, c1[c0]hs0, c3[c2]hs0)
  breq123d(c1, c0, hs0, c3, c2, hs0, w0)
  eqidd(hs0, w0)
  pweqd(⋃ ran(c0), ⋃ ran(c2), w0)
  unieqd(ran(c0), ran(c2), w0)
  rneqd(c0, c2, w0)
  df-afv2(hs0, c0, c1)
  df-afv2(hs0, c2, c3)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: nfafv2
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for function value, analogous to ~ nffv . To prove a deduction version of this analogous to ~ nffvd is not easily possible because a deduction version of ~ nfdfat cannot be shown easily. (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2022.)

thm nfafv2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wnfc(s0, cafv2(c0, c1))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c1)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, cafv2(c0, c1), cif(cio(hs0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c0))), wdfat(c0, c1)))
  df-afv2(hs0, c0, c1)
  nfif(s0, cio(hs0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0))), cpw(cuni(crn(c0))), wdfat(c0, c1))
  nfdfat(s0, c0, c1)
  nfiota(s0, hs0, wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0)))
  nfbr(s0, c1, c0, cv(hs0))
  nfcv(s0, cv(hs0))
  nfpw(s0, cuni(crn(c0)))
  nfuni(s0, crn(c0))
  nfrn(s0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

thm nfafv2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ F/(s0,(c0 '''' c1))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c1)
} = {
  nfcxfr(s0, (c0 '''' c1), if(c0[defAt]c1, iota(hs0, c1[c0]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c0))))
  df-afv2(hs0, c0, c1)
  nfif(s0, iota(hs0, c1[c0]hs0), P(⋃ ran(c0)), c0[defAt]c1)
  nfdfat(s0, c0, c1)
  nfiota(s0, hs0, c1[c0]hs0)
  nfbr(s0, c1, c0, hs0)
  nfcv(s0, hs0)
  nfpw(s0, ⋃ ran(c0))
  nfuni(s0, ran(c0))
  nfrn(s0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: csbafv212g
blocks.content: Move class substitution in and out of a function value, analogous to ~ csbfv12 , with a direct proof proposed by Mario Carneiro, analogous to ~ csbov123 . (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm csbafv212g(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(csb(s0, c0, cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3))))
} = {
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, wceq(csb(s0, c0, cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3))), wceq(csb(s0, cv(hs0), cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3))))
  eqeq12d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3)), csb(s0, c0, cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, cafv2(c2, c3))
  afv2eq12d(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c2)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), c0, c3)
  csbief(s0, cv(hs0), cafv2(c2, c3), cafv2(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3)))
  vex(hs0)
  nfafv2(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3))
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  afv2eq12d(c2, c3, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c3), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(csb(s0, c0, cafv2(c2, c3)), cafv2(csb(s0, c0, c2), csb(s0, c0, c3))))

thm csbafv212g(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →[c0 / s0](c2 '''' c3)=([c0 / s0]c2 ''''[c0 / s0]c3))
} = {
  vtoclg(hs0, c0, c1, [c0 / s0](c2 '''' c3)=([c0 / s0]c2 ''''[c0 / s0]c3), [hs0 / s0](c2 '''' c3)=([hs0 / s0]c2 ''''[hs0 / s0]c3))
  eqeq12d([hs0 / s0](c2 '''' c3), ([hs0 / s0]c2 ''''[hs0 / s0]c3), [c0 / s0](c2 '''' c3), ([c0 / s0]c2 ''''[c0 / s0]c3), hs0 = c0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, (c2 '''' c3))
  afv2eq12d([hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]c3, [c0 / s0]c2, [c0 / s0]c3, hs0 = c0)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c2)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, c0, c3)
  csbief(s0, hs0, (c2 '''' c3), ([hs0 / s0]c2 ''''[hs0 / s0]c3))
  vex(hs0)
  nfafv2(s0, [hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]c3)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c2)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c3)
  afv2eq12d(c2, c3, [hs0 / s0]c2, [hs0 / s0]c3, s0 = hs0)
  csbeq1a(s0, hs0, c2)
  csbeq1a(s0, hs0, c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w([c0 / s0](c2 '''' c3)=([c0 / s0]c2 ''''[c0 / s0]c3))

}

blocks.name: fexafv2ex
blocks.content: The alternate function value is always a set if the function (resp. the domain of the function) is a set. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ndfatafv2nrn
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` at which the function is not defined is undefined, i.e., not in the range of the function. (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: ndmafv2nrn
blocks.content: The value of a class outside its domain is not in the range, compare with ~ ndmfv . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: funressndmafv2rn
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` is defined, i.e., in the range of the function if the function is defined at ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

  iotabidv(hs0, wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)), wbr(c1, c0, cv(hs0)))

  syl(wa(wfun(cres(c0, csn(cv(hs1)))), wcel(cv(hs1), cdm(c0))), wex(hs2, wcel(cop(cv(hs2), cio(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)))), c0)), wcel(cop(cv(hs1), cio(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)))), c0))
  sylib(wa(wfun(cres(c0, csn(cv(hs1)))), wcel(cv(hs1), cdm(c0))), wcel(cop(cv(hs1), cio(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)))), c0), wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cio(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)))))

blocks.name: nfunsnafv2
blocks.content: If the restriction of a class to a singleton is not a function, its value at the singleton element is undefined, compare with ~ nfunsn . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2prc
blocks.content: A function's value at a proper class is not defined, compare with ~ fvprc . (Contributed by AV, 5-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: dfatafv2rnb
blocks.content: The alternate function value at a class ` A ` is defined, i.e. in the range of the function, iff the function is defined at ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2orxorb
blocks.content: If a set is in the range of a function, the alternate function value at a class ` A ` equals this set or is not in the range of the function iff the alternate function value at the class ` A ` either equals this set or is not in the range of the function. If ` B e/ ran F ` , both disjuncts of the exclusive or can be true: ` ( F '''' A ) = B ` ` -> ( F '''' A ) e/ ran F ` . (Contributed by AV, 11-Sep-2022.)

  eleq2i(c1, cdm(ccom(c2, c0)), cab(hs1, wex(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), ccom(c2, c0), cv(hs0)))))
  df-dm(hs1, hs0, ccom(c2, c0))
  syl(wa(wdfat(c0, c1), wdfat(c2, cafv2(c0, c1))), wb(wcel(c1, cab(hs1, wex(hs0, wbr(cv(hs1), ccom(c2, c0), cv(hs0))))), wex(hs0, wbr(c1, ccom(c2, c0), cv(hs0)))), wcel(c1, cdm(c0)))
  adantr(wdfat(c0, c1), wdfat(c2, cafv2(c0, c1)), wcel(c1, cdm(c0)))

  eleq2i(c1, dom((c2 ∘ c0)), { hs1 | ∃(hs0, hs1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0)})
  df-dm(hs1, hs0, (c2 ∘ c0))
  syl((c0[defAt]c1 ∧ c2[defAt](c0 '''' c1)), (c1 ∈ { hs1 | ∃(hs0, hs1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0)} ↔ ∃(hs0, c1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0)), c1 ∈ dom(c0))
  adantr(c0[defAt]c1, c2[defAt](c0 '''' c1), c1 ∈ dom(c0))
  simplbi(c0[defAt]c1, c1 ∈ dom(c0), Fun((c0 |` { c1 })))
  df-dfat(c0, c1)
  elabg(hs1, c1, dom(c0), ∃(hs0, hs1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0), ∃(hs0, c1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0))
  exbidv(hs0, hs1 = c1, hs1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0, c1[(c2 ∘ c0)]hs0)
  breq1(hs1, c1, (c2 ∘ c0), hs0)
  dfatcolem(hs0, c0, c1, c2)
  dfdfat2(hs0, (c2 ∘ c0), c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)

  diff.hs1.s(hs0)

}

  imaeq2d(c2, csn(cafv2(c0, c1)), cima(c0, csn(c1)), wa(wdfat(c0, c1), wdfat(c2, cafv2(c0, c1))))

thm afv2ndeffv0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 '''' c1)∉ ran(c0)→(c0 ` c1)= ∅)
} = {
  sylbi((c0 '''' c1)∉ ran(c0), (c0 ` c1)= ∅, (¬ c1 ∈ dom(c0)∨ ¬ Fun((c0 |` { c1 }))))
  3bitri((c0 '''' c1)∉ ran(c0), (¬ c1 ∈ dom(c0)∨ ¬ Fun((c0 |` { c1 }))), ¬(c0 '''' c1)∈ ran(c0), ¬(c1 ∈ dom(c0)∧ Fun((c0 |` { c1 }))))
  df-nel((c0 '''' c1), ran(c0))
  notbii((c0 '''' c1)∈ ran(c0), (c1 ∈ dom(c0)∧ Fun((c0 |` { c1 }))))
  bitr3i((c0 '''' c1)∈ ran(c0), (c1 ∈ dom(c0)∧ Fun((c0 |` { c1 }))), c0[defAt]c1)
  dfatafv2rnb(c0, c1)
  df-dfat(c0, c1)
  ianor(c1 ∈ dom(c0), Fun((c0 |` { c1 })))
  jaoi(¬ c1 ∈ dom(c0), ¬ Fun((c0 |` { c1 })), (c0 ` c1)= ∅)
  ndmfv(c1, c0)
  nfunsn(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: dfatafv2eqfv
blocks.content: If a function is defined at a class ` A ` , the alternate function value equals the function's value at ` A ` . (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2rnfveq
blocks.content: If the alternate function value is defined, i.e., in the range of the function, the alternate function value equals the function's value. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv20fv0
blocks.content: If the alternate function value at an argument is the empty set, the function's value at this argument is the empty set. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2fvn0fveq
blocks.content: If the function's value at an argument is not the empty set, it equals the alternate function value at this argument. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2fv0
blocks.content: If the function's value at an argument is the empty set, then the alternate function value at this argument is the empty set or undefined. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2fv0b
blocks.content: The function's value at an argument is the empty set if and only if the alternate function value at this argument is the empty set or undefined. (Contributed by AV, 3-Sep-2022.)

blocks.name: afv2fv0xorb
blocks.content: If a set is in the range of a function, the function's value at an argument is the empty set if and only if the alternate function value at this argument is either the empty set or undefined. (Contributed by AV, 11-Sep-2022.)
